title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: DANS SON TORT, in the wrong.

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I shall ever think onyou with gratitude, and the worst of my censure shall be, QUE DIABLEALLOIT-IL FAIRE DANS CETTE GALERE?'

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: He craves you, sir, to drown in oblivionthe memory of such solecisms against the laws of politeness, as beingwhat his better reason disavows, and to receive the hand which he offersyou in amity; and I must needs assure you, that nothing less than asense of being DANS SON TORT, as a gallant French chevalier, Mons, LeBretailleur, once said to me on such an occasion, and an opinion alsoof your peculiar merit, could have extorted such concessions; for he andall his family are, and have been time out of mind, MAVORTIA PECTORA, asBuchanan saith, a bold and warlike sept, or people.'

title: The Edinburgh tales.
author: Johnstone, C. I.
snippet: Dans 1' un, ce sut tel plaidoyer hypocrite, en 1'autre tel ebauche de systeme, tous deux se donnant un faux air d' orateur et de legislateur.
